definitions.definition: a piece of healthy skin or bone cut from one part of a person's body and used to repair another damaged part, or a piece cut from one living plant and attached to another plant so that it grows there:
examples: He has had a skin graft on his badly burned arm.

definitions.definition: to take and put in place a graft:
examples: Skin was removed from her leg and grafted on/onto her face.

definitions.definition: to join or add something new:
examples: The management tried unsuccessfully to graft new working methods onto the existing ways of doing things.
